content: not included round 5 single_crochet chain double_crochet in the next stitch x2 double_crochet 2 into chain space chain 2 fptc chain 2 double_crochet 2 into chain space double_crochet in the next stitch x13 double_crochet 2 into chain space chain 2 x3 fptc chain 2 double_crochet 2 into chain space double_crochet in the next stitch x10 ij total 64 chains not included 6 photo tutorials don t see the part you re interested in write me a pm blo/tlo wrong side right side tlo - third blo - back loop only loop only flo - front loop only invisible join 1 cut the yarn and pull the loop to make one string pull the cut yarn through the loop and insert the hook in the first loop of this round 2 pull the yarn to the other side 3 insert the hook into the last chain back loop only and pull the yarn to the other side weave in the rest of the yarn 4 overview from the top joining the leaves to the square succulent spiky ends while making round s2 you may pin the leaves to the square by yarning over through the last back bump of the chain of the petal before finishing the double crochet stitch and yarning over through the three loops on your hook the number of stitches in round s2 is 40 and the number of leaves is 5 so you may pin in the listed stitches below 2 10 18 24 32 40 little plant attaching the leaves to the base is simmilar to pining the petals - yarn over through the last back bump of the chain of the petal before finishing the double_crochet stitch and yarning over through the three loops on your hook 13 photo tutorials modified invisible join 1 start the modified invisible join by pulling the working yarn and creating a bigger loop 2 insert the hook from the back in the first loop from this round 3 pull the loop through the stitch to the other side of your work 4 insert your hook in the 5 pull the loop to the other last back loop of this round side make a chain tc3cluster with chains at the top 1 chain 3 2 tc3cluster 2 to create a crochet cluster begin by initiating a basic crochet stitch such as a triple treble crochet but refrain from finishing the stitch instead proceed to make two more partial crochet stitches all within the same stitch base once three partial stitches are formed on your hook complete the cluster by performing a final yarn over and drawing it through all the loops on the hook 3 chain 3 slip_stitch 4 overview to the after slip_stitch marked loop note the same applies to the following dc3cluster* - 3 double_crochet with the same base and top dc2cluster* - 2 double_crochet with the same base and top 14
